newsitem.title: FRANCE: BELGIUM'S CCB H1 PROFIT TO BE "VERY GOOD" - CLF.
newsitem.headline: BELGIUM'S CCB H1 PROFIT TO BE "VERY GOOD" - CLF.

text.p: Credit Communal de Belgique/Gemeentekrediet (CCB) should report a "very good" first-half result, Pierre Richard, chairman of Credit Local de France , said on Wednesday.
Richard said Francois Narmon, chairman of CCB, had authorised him to say that the Belgian lender's first half results would be "very favourable, I could even say excellent".

The two banks, which specialise in loans to local and regional public authorities, are due to form an alliance at the end of the year in which they will take cross-holdings in each other's share capital.
Richard made the comments at a news conference after the bank reported net attributable profit for the six months to the end of June rose to 793 million francs from 748 million.
